programme.title: Greed
programme.desc: A damaging public inquiry tarnishes the image of a self-made fashion billionaire. To save his reputation, he decides to bounce back with a highly publicized and extravagant party celebrating his 60th birthday on the Greek island of Mykonos.

programme.title: Limitless
programme.desc: Facing unemployment and his girlfriend's rejection, writer Eddie Morra (Bradley Cooper) is sure that he has no future. That all changes when an old friend gives him a drug that produces enhanced mental acuity. Stoked on the untested chemical, Eddie rises to the top of the financial world and attracts the attention of a tycoon (Robert De Niro) who intends to use him to make a fortune. But terrible side-effects and a dwindling supply threaten to collapse Eddie's house of cards.

programme.title: Blue Collar
programme.desc: When Detroit autoworkers Zeke Brown (Richard Pryor), Jerry Bartowski (Harvey Keitel) and Smokey James (Yaphet Kotto) decide to rob their own union, they are initially disappointed by the relatively small haul. However, upon closer inspection, the three amateur thieves discover that they have made off with something potentially much more valuable than money: the union's ledger, filled with bogus figures and links to organized crime. Should they blackmail the union or go to the authorities?

actor.role: Eddie Johnson Union President AAW Local 291

programme.title: Fever Pitch
programme.desc: When Ben Wrightman (Jimmy Fallon), a young teacher, begins dating pretty businesswoman Lindsey Meeks (Drew Barrymore), the two don't seem to have a lot of the same interests, but they fall in love, regardless. Their romance goes well until baseball season begins, and Lindsey soon realizes that Ben is completely obsessed with the Boston Red Sox. Though she tries to understand Ben's passionate team loyalty, eventually it threatens to end their otherwise happy relationship.

programme.title: Kiss Me Goodbye
programme.desc: Kay (Sally Field) is a widow who's met a handsome but otherwise dull Egyptologist named Rupert (Jeff Bridges) and hopes to marry. Trouble is, the ghost of her dead husband, Jolly (James Caan), strenuously objects. A former Broadway director, he's visible only to Kay, and begins interfering in her life so much that others question her sanity. Jolly, however, cares only about driving away the hated Rupert, who for his part thinks to stage an exorcism.

programme.title: Going the Distance
programme.desc: Erin (Drew Barrymore) and Garrett (Justin Long) are very much in love. When Erin moves to San Francisco to finish her journalism degree and Garrett stays behind in New York to work in the music industry, they gamely keep the romance alive with webcams and frequent-flyer miles. But just when it seems the lovers will soon be reunited, they each score a big break that could separate them for good.

programme.title: Greed
programme.desc: A damaging public inquiry tarnishes the image of a self-made fashion billionaire. To save his reputation, he decides to bounce back with a highly publicized and extravagant party celebrating his 60th birthday on the Greek island of Mykonos.

programme.title: Heartbreakers
programme.desc: Max (Sigourney Weaver) and Page (Jennifer Love Hewitt) are a brilliant mother/daughter con team who have their grift down to a fine science. Max targets wealthy, willing men and marries them. Page then seduces them, and Max catches her husband in the act. Then it's off to palimony city and the next easy mark.

programme.title: Stay Cool
programme.desc: A successful author (Mark Polish) reunites with a high-school beauty (Winona Ryder) when he returns to his hometown.

programme.title: Married With Secrets
programme.desc: In Arkansas, Lisa Bradford lives a quiet life with her husband, Dennis, and their two young children, then the police arrive on their doorstep to make a revelation so heinous it rips their marriage apart.

programme.title: Married With Secrets
programme.desc: Police believe the beating and fatal stabbing of a Northern California couple was a robbery gone wrong until investigators hone in on the motive and learn about the killer's twisted double life.

programme.title: Married With Secrets
programme.desc: The decomposed body of a San Francisco businessman is found floating in the California Aqueduct; investigators initially suspect a family member, but without evidence, the case goes cold; it takes detectives several decades to find the real killer.

programme.title: Married With Secrets
programme.desc: In Fox Lake, Ill., chaos ensues when a police officer is murdered, and the town goes on lockdown, then sordid details from the victim's life emerge, causing the case to take a surprising turn.

programme.title: Fatal Vows
programme.desc: Janice thinks Brett is an old-fashioned country boy who needs a woman's touch, while Brett thinks Janice is the ideal woman to turn his house into a home; as family tragedies mount, their dream of a perfect life together soon goes up in flames.

programme.title: Fatal Vows
programme.desc: Rebecca Murray falls for Lee Mikael Cawthon and soon exotic dancer Allite Franks and best friend, Thad join the relationship as a third and fourth partner, but this open-minded foursome soon discovers there's no harmony in polyamory.

programme.title: Fatal Vows
programme.desc: When Opal Skidmore marries Steven Williams, their love is a second chance for the pair to live out their dreams; soon, boredom and the lure of the open road spark hidden desires and sexual hijinks, leaving this open marriage anything but happy.

programme.title: Fatal Vows
programme.desc: Pad is rich and handsome, and Kem is popular but from the wrong side of town; the power couple stick it out despite disapproval, and over the years amass a fortune; however, they soon learn that their money can't buy love and happiness -only death.

programme.title: Prisoner of Love
programme.desc: Chelsea's boyfriend is released; Brey finds out about Arlette's past (New!).

programme.title: Prisoner of Love
programme.desc: After an explosive argument, Aluntra has doubts about marrying Bryce (New!).

programme.title: Love Gone South
programme.desc: When a Memphis mother is shot at a gas station, detectives are left wondering if this was just a robbery gone wrong, or worse (New!).

programme.title: Deadly Affairs: Betrayed by Love
programme.desc: When a new pastor arrives at their church, Randy and Teresa Stone learn that a passionate affair can lead to murder; a bizarre hunting accident reveals the true motive behind a close friendship (New!).

programme.title: Deadly Affairs: Betrayed by Love
programme.desc: The McGuires have it all, but when one of them cheats, their marriage ends with two bullets and three suitcases; happily married Ignacio and Heather Garraus live an ideal life until a wandering eye leads Ignacio astray.

programme.title: 20/20 on ID
programme.desc: On a cross-country killing spree, drifter Andrew Cunanan shoots and kills Italian fashion designer Gianni Versace who is at the height of his fame.

programme.title: Love Gone South

programme.desc: The McGuires have it all, but when one of them cheats, their marriage ends with two bullets and three suitcases; happily married Ignacio and Heather Garraus live an ideal life until a wandering eye leads Ignacio astray.

programme.title: 20/20 on ID
programme.desc: In a football-crazed town, a star player and a teenage girl end up in a he-said, she-said controversy after a raucous party; investigators ask what happened when the two of them went into a bedroom during the party and closed the door behind them.

programme.title: Scorned: Love Kills
programme.desc: A former beauty queen, looking for a high-end lifestyle, is appointed a head nurse and will stop at nothing to obtain the life she feels she deserves.

programme.title: Scorned: Love Kills
programme.desc: A love triangle explodes into a grisly crime scene.

programme.title: Aaron Hernandez: An ID Murder Mystery
programme.desc: After NFL football player Aaron Hernandez's friend is found dead near his home, investigators turn their gaze on the tight end; at trial, a family drama unfolds as Hernandez fights for his life; later, Hernandez is linked to another brutal slaying.

programme.title: Aaron Hernandez: An ID Murder Mystery
programme.desc: Facing charges for the murder of Odin Lloyd, Aaron Hernandez's once acclaimed star status is in free fall; the testimony of two sisters threatens to tear a family apart; the trial reaches a conclusion, but Aaron's troubles are far from over.

programme.title: Aaron Hernandez: An ID Murder Mystery
programme.desc: With lawyer Jose Baez by his side, Aaron Hernandez is back in the courtroom facing startling new allegations; after the verdict, his life takes another violent turn; Hernandez's high school friend reveals long-buried secrets from their past.

programme.title: Murder Under the Friday Night Lights
programme.desc: In a small Texas town, a serial rapist stalks and attacks multiple high school cheerleaders before graduating to murder; detectives discover the monster behind these horrific crimes is much closer to home than anyone could have possibly guessed.

programme.title: Murder Under the Friday Night Lights
programme.desc: Conspiracy theories rock a small Texas town after a beloved high school football player mysteriously vanishes; baffling clues and community pressure pit the local sheriff against a brash private investigator until some unusual suspects emerge.

programme.title: Murder Under the Friday Night Lights
programme.desc: A beloved high school teacher's mutilated body lies in a field near her home, leaving behind a baffling trail of evidence; one suspect tells a story that makes no sense, but the real killer's motives are as confusing as they are terrifying.

programme.title: Murder Under the Friday Night Lights
programme.desc: In a struggling Pennsylvania coal town where high school football is king, the killing of a Mexican immigrant splits the community; when star players emerge as suspects, some locals engage in a cover-up that is almost as shocking as the murder.

programme.title: Murder Under the Friday Night Lights
programme.desc: When high school football coach Juan Joseph is inexplicably gunned down, his community unites to bring his killer to justice.

programme.title: Murder Under the Friday Night Lights
programme.desc: A cold-blooded murderer takes the life of local football hero TK Kelly; the high school standout had carried the dreams of his small California city on his shoulders, but for someone close to TK, jealousy of the star was motivation enough to kill.

programme.title: Fall of a Football Star
programme.desc: Once thought to be a rising star in the NFL, Rae Carruth falls from grace after conspiring to have his pregnant girlfriend, Cherica Adams, murdered.

programme.title: Death of a Lineman
programme.desc: Marlin Barnes, a linebacker for the University of Miami, is found murdered in his apartment, along with his friend, Timwanika Lumpkins; detectives must retrace the victims' footsteps to find their killer.

programme.title: Deadly Recall
programme.desc: Former Tennessee Titan quarterback and public hero Steve McNair is found dead in his condo; the body of a young female is also present in an apparent double homicide.

programme.title: Signs of a Psychopath
programme.desc: Police respond to a 911 call to find a father dead in his home with more than 15 gunshot wounds.

programme.title: Signs of a Psychopath
programme.desc: A former escort hires a hit man to kill her husband; she thinks she's committed the perfect crime when officers notify her that he is dead; little does she know that the police have been watching and recording her every move.

programme.title: Signs of a Psychopath
programme.desc: A college student disappears at the start of his freshman year without a trace, leaving his family and his girlfriend reeling; when authorities look to his best friend for answers, they uncover a love triangle gone wrong.

programme.title: Signs of a Psychopath
programme.desc: A troubled 29-year-old son is kicked out of his parents' house after spending the family fortune on a web-cam model; his mother, father and brother are found murdered, the young man insists he's innocent.

programme.title: Signs of a Psychopath
programme.desc: The naked and mutilated body of a mother turns up at the bottom of a ravine in Baton Rouge, La.; when tire tracks lead investigators to a suspect, they encounter an undetected serial killer who confesses to butchering eight women over a decade.

programme.title: Signs of a Psychopath
programme.desc: A young woman makes a frantic 911 call about a brutal home invasion, which results in the shooting of her mother and father; as police interview her, they uncover a secret double life and an elaborate web of lies spun by a maniacal psychopath.

programme.title: Signs of a Psychopath
programme.sub-title: Now They Lay Me Down to Sleep, Part 1

programme.title: Step Up Revolution
programme.desc: Newly arrived in Miami, young dancer Emily (Kathryn McCormick) dreams of becoming a professional. She soon meets and falls in love with Sean (Ryan Guzman), the leader of a dance crew called "the Mob." When a rich businessman's plans to develop the dancers' historic neighborhood threatens to displace thousands of people, Emily must join forces with Sean and the Mob to turn their performance art into protest art, even though doing so may place her dreams in jeopardy.

programme.title: Fear of a Black Hat
programme.desc: This mock documentary follows sociologist Nina Blackburn (Kasi Lemmons) during the year she spends studying hip-hop artists Ice Cold (Rusty Cundieff), Tasty-Taste (Larry B. Scott), Tone Def (Mark Christopher Lawrence) and a series of disappearing white managers. Every rap cliché is on display: sex, sexism, violent imagery and paint-peeling profanity -- all of it, the group insists, with a deeper political meaning -- plus the inevitable rivalry with other rappers and ultimately themselves.

programme.title: A Thousand Words
programme.desc: Jack McCall (Eddie Murphy) is a selfish literary agent whose fast-talking ways allow him to close any deal. His next target is New Age guru Dr. Sinja (Cliff Curtis), but the savvy doctor sees right through Jack. A magical tree appears in Jack's yard, and, according to Dr. Sinja, the tree and Jack are connected; every time Jack says a word, a leaf falls from the tree. When the last leaf drops, Jack will die. With just a thousand leaves left, Jack must learn to curb his speech or he's a goner.

programme.title: Beauty Shop
programme.desc: Far from Chicago, hairdresser Gina Norris (Queen Latifah) has relocated to Atlanta with her daughter (Paige Hurd) and has quickly established herself as a rare talent in her profession. But after repeatedly butting heads with her shady, over-the-top boss, Jorge (Kevin Bacon), Norris sets out to create her own salon -- even snagging a few of Jorge's employees and clients, including Lynn (Alicia Silverstone) and Terri (Andie MacDowell), respectively. Now, Jorge will do anything to shut her down.

programme.title: Last Holiday
programme.desc: The discovery that she has a terminal illness prompts introverted saleswoman Georgia Byrd (Queen Latifah) to reflect on what she realizes has been an overly cautious life. So Georgia withdraws her life savings and jets off to Europe where she lives like a millionaire. Upbeat and passionate, Georgia charms everybody she meets, including renowned Chef Didier (Gérard Depardieu). The only one missing from her new life is her longtime crush Sean Matthews (LL Cool J).

programme.title: Everything's Gonna Be All White
programme.desc: Exploring the history of race in America from the perspective of people of color, featuring insights from noted historians, cultural commentators, actors, activists and artists.

programme.title: Twenties

programme.desc: Nia works on her social media presence and Hattie plays house at Ida B.'s, and receives harsh feedback on her script; as Marie's relationship with Chuck becomes even more strained, things heat up with Zach at the office (New!).

programme.title: We Need to Talk About Cosby
programme.desc: During the '70s, Bill Cosby takes a circuitous path to becoming an on-screen educator and moral authority, whether by telling kids to say "no" to drugs or allegedly slipping them to young women, reaching massive acclaim with the special "Himself.".

programme.title: Support the Girls
programme.desc: Lisa is the general manager of Double Whammies, a sports bar that features skimpily dressed waitresses. Always nurturing and protective of her staff, she soon faces one trying day that tests her optimism at every turn.

programme.title: Mid90s
programme.desc: In 1990s Los Angeles, a 13-year-old spends his summer navigating between a troubled home life and a crew of new friends he meets at a skate shop.

programme.title: Chocolate City

programme.title: Waves
programme.desc: The epic emotional journey of a suburban African American family as they navigate love, forgiveness and coming together in the wake of a tragic loss.

programme.title: The Challenger

programme.title: Kevin Garnett: Anything Is Possible

programme.title: Madonna & Basquiat
programme.desc: 1980s New York artist Jean Michel Basquiat spends a night out with his not-yet discovered girlfriend Madonna, before a pivotal moment in both their lives.

programme.title: Hands Up
programme.desc: After his cousin is shot and killed by a white police officer in Chicago, and Black Lives Matter protests spread across the city, a Black teen desperately fights for a way out of the most notorious murder capital in America.

programme.title: The Last Black Man in San Francisco
programme.desc: Jimmie and his best friend Mont try to reclaim the house built by Jimmie's grandfather, launching them on a poignant odyssey that connects them to their past, even as it tests their friendship and sense of belonging in the place they call home.

programme.title: Scary Movie V
programme.desc: Much bizarre activity follows after a husband (Simon Rex) and wife (Ashley Tisdale) bring their newborn infant home from the hospital. When they realize that a demon is stalking their family, they consult paranormal specialists and install numerous cameras to drive out the pesky spirit. Movies that are spoofed in the familiar format include the "Paranormal Activity" franchise, "Mama," "Sinister," "Evil Dead," "Inception," "Black Swan" and "Rise of the Planet of the Apes.".

programme.title: Gary Owen: Black Famous
programme.desc: This last year has been unlike any other: COVID, lockdowns, and for Gary, it has also included a divorce and family insanity unlike any other; up until now, Gary hasn't been able to speak about what really happened.

programme.title: Reign Over Me
programme.desc: Charlie Fineman (Adam Sandler), who lost his family in the terrorist attacks of Sept. 11, still grieves over their deaths. He runs into his former college roommate, Alan Johnson (Don Cheadle), and the two rekindle their friendship. Alan himself is feeling the strain of family and professional responsibilities, and his renewed bond with Charlie gives both men the strength to carry on during a turning point in their lives.

programme.title: The Wash
programme.desc: "The Wash" is an action-comedy starring Snoop Dogg and Dr. Dre. As mismatched roommates working at a car wash, they come together to rescue their boss (George Wallace) from a couple of first-time kidnappers. If they don't settle their differences and get Mr. Washington back, the good times at "The Wash" will soon come to an end.

programme.title: The Queens of Comedy
programme.desc: Starting where "The Kings of Comedy" left off, this stand-up performance offers a night of comedy from a distinctively female perspective. Recorded live at the Orpheum Theatre in Memphis, Tenn., "The Queens of Comedy" features comedians Mo'Nique, Adele Givens, Sommore and Laura Hayes sharing their uncensored views on life, men and sex. Laura Hayes opens up the show with anecdotes about her crazy family, and Mo'Nique brings down the house with a raunchy closing act.

programme.title: Zola
programme.desc: Zola, a Detroit waitress, is seduced into a weekend of stripping in Florida for some quick cash -- but the trip becomes a sleepless 48-hour odyssey involving a nefarious friend, her pimp and her idiot boyfriend.

programme.title: Everything's Gonna Be All White
programme.desc: Exploring the history of race in America from the perspective of people of color, featuring insights from noted historians, cultural commentators, actors, activists and artists.

programme.title: The Manchurian Candidate
programme.desc: Years after his squad was ambushed during the Gulf War, Major Ben Marco (Denzel Washington) finds himself having terrible nightmares. He begins to doubt that his fellow squad-mate Sergeant Raymond Shaw (Liev Schreiber), now a vice-presidential candidate, is the hero he remembers him being. As Marco's doubts deepen, Shaw's political power grows, and, when Marco finds a mysterious implant embedded in his back, the memory of what really happened begins to return.

programme.title: Best of Showtime Boxing 2021
programme.desc: Taking another look at some of the year's top moments in boxing.

programme.title: You're Watching Video Music Box
programme.desc: "Video Music Box," launched in 1983 and hosted in New York City by DJ Ralph McDaniels, showcases hip-hop videos and introduces viewers to future stars like Nas, Jay Z, LL Cool J, Nicki Minaj and Fat Joe long before they become icons of the genre.

programme.title: We Need to Talk About Cosby
programme.desc: Cosby strikes gold with "The Cosby Show" and leverages his growing power inside the entertainment industry to allegedly commit and conceal a multitude of sins; as the sitcom ends, Cosby evolves from America's dad into America's angry grandpa (New!).

programme.title: The Guard
programme.desc: A vulgar Irish cop (Brendan Gleeson) and a straight-laced American FBI agent (Don Cheadle) uncover police corruption among the former's superiors while probing a drug-trafficking ring.

programme.title: Jamel Shabazz Street Photographer
programme.desc: The life and work of photographer Jamel Shabazz.

programme.title: Moonlight
programme.desc: A look at three defining chapters in the life of Chiron, a young black man growing up in Miami. His epic journey to manhood is guided by the kindness, support and love of the community that helps raise him.

programme.title: Mother of George
programme.desc: Ayodele (Isaach De Bankolé) and Adenike (Danai Gurira) marry and start a new life. As months pass without a pregnancy, Adenike feels torn between her Yoruba culture and her new life in America, struggling to save her marriage.

programme.title: A Raisin in the Sun
programme.desc: Lena Younger (Phylicia Rashad) receives a settlement from her husband's life insurance policy and then must decide what to do with the money. She wants to move out of their apartment into a house in a more genteel neighborhood. Her eldest son, Walter (Sean Combs), aspires to be an entrepreneur. Daughter Beneatha (Sanaa Lathan) hopes to go to medical school. Though their aspirations collide, they try to find a way to retain their family's cohesion.

programme.title: Step Up Revolution
programme.desc: Newly arrived in Miami, young dancer Emily (Kathryn McCormick) dreams of becoming a professional. She soon meets and falls in love with Sean (Ryan Guzman), the leader of a dance crew called "the Mob." When a rich businessman's plans to develop the dancers' historic neighborhood threatens to displace thousands of people, Emily must join forces with Sean and the Mob to turn their performance art into protest art, even though doing so may place her dreams in jeopardy.

programme.title: Barbershop 2: Back in Business
programme.desc: This sequel to the 2002 film returns to the Chicago barbershop owned by Calvin Palmer Jr. (Ice Cube). His employees -- Isaac (Troy Garity), Terri (Eve), Ricky (Michael Ealy), Dinka (Leonard Earl Howze) and Kenard -- have their own personal and workplace problems, and a new barbershop called Nappy Cutz has moved in across the street. As Calvin tries to change the character of his business, Nappy Cutz and gentrification become a threat to the surrounding community.

programme.title: I Got the Hook-Up
programme.desc: Friends Black (Master P) and Blue (Anthony Johnson) are broke, but they think they've found their big break when they get a truckload delivery of cell phones by mistake. With the help of Black's girlfriend, Lorraine (Gretchen Palmer), they start selling them to whoever wants to buy them, and soon they're rolling in cash. But there's a big problem with the phones: They don't work. Their unhappy customers, including local gang members, are ready to take them down -- and so is the FBI.

programme.title: MeatEater's Das Boat
programme.desc: After a bumpy start, Steve gets to South Haven, Mich., where he recruits the help of local charter captain Grant Gully. Steve, Grant, and a local fabricator put in 10 hours of work getting the boat ready to fish for lake trout in 100 feet of water.

programme.title: On the Water With Hank Parker
programme.desc: Hank and his buddy, Shane, are headed to the Menomonee River for a really fun day of fishing. The species... well... a little bit of everything.

programme.title: Fishing With Roland Martin
programme.desc: In Florida, the Whopper Plopper caught some big bass and the biggest, an eight and a half pound monster, hits just before a big storm. In Missouri the big bass were on the logs and shore line timber.

programme.title: Saltwater Underground With Nick Honachefsky
programme.sub-title: Busting up Knucklehead Black Sea Bass
programme.desc: Black sea bass gain knucklehead status when they hit the five pound mark. Nick joins Capt. Al Crudele and Sean Reilly to tangle with knuckleheads on the Jersey shipwrecks.

programme.title: BC Outdoors Sportfishing
programme.desc: Mike heads out with his daughters and guide Sam Noble to target ling cod, rock fish, and chinook salmon in Nootka Sound.

programme.title: The Fishmonger

programme.title: Jim Shockey's: The Professionals
programme.desc: Jim and his team try to get the biggest bear of the season.

programme.title: North American Whitetail

programme.title: Trigger Effect
programme.desc: Dean and Kent hunt the dry bush veld of East Cape, Africa pursuing the Red Lechwe and Impala with Royal Karoo Safaris.

programme.title: Big Deer TV
programme.desc: CZ-USA's Jason Morton joins Mike for a late season hunt in the Texas brush country.

programme.title: Pigman: The Series

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: The hunt for coues deer continues, and the ranch chef prepares chili Colorado tamales with venison.

programme.title: Jim Shockey's Hunting Adventures
programme.desc: Wojo hunts a specific buck that he's been watching. Experience the highs and lows of a fall whitetail hunt in Saskatchewan.

programme.title: Dropped

programme.title: Winchester & Drury's Natural Born
programme.desc: Trio of big midwest whitetail bucks on display.

programme.title: Realtree's Monster Bucks

programme.title: Pigman: The Series
programme.desc: Pigman, Dap and Junie share their favorite moments from Season 12.

programme.title: Steve's Outdoor Adventures

programme.title: Nordic Wild Hunter: Kristoffer Clausen
programme.desc: Ruffe is a dog of the breed Finnish Spitz and he will be joining Kristoffer on this trip.

programme.title: BuckVentures

programme.title: Trekin Outdoors

programme.title: Big Cats
programme.desc: In Ruaha, Tanzania, lions form huge super prides in order to hunt large, formidable prey. In Tanzania, a tiny rusty-spotted cat is 200 times smaller than a lion, but they are just as curious as they explore their forest home.

programme.title: Kenya Wildlife Diaries
programme.desc: Kenya takes a major step towards creating the country's first community-run rhino sanctuary. Find out why Lewa considers this the right move, and witness teams move rhinos from across the country to this new conservancy.

programme.title: Kenya Wildlife Diaries
programme.desc: Follow Kenyan capture teams to the Somali border to catch 50 rare and endangered antelope that need to be relocated into a predator-free conservancy. With no roads and the two nations at war, the operation must be carried out by helicopter.

programme.title: Wildlife Icons
programme.desc: Winter in Marakele National Park is one of the scarcest, but also most plentiful, times of the year. See how a giraffe's demise becomes a source of life for the region's vultures, whose survival depends on the decaying flesh of animals like these.

programme.title: Wildlife Icons
programme.desc: Cape Town, South Africa is home to twenty types of frogs, but many are threatened by urban development. Meet a variety of the region's species as we follow western leopard toads on their tenuous journey to breed in the city's shrinking wetlands.

programme.title: Wildlife Icons
programme.desc: Once superabundant, African Elephant populations have declined drastically due to hunting. Get an in-depth look into the lives of the most powerful land mammals on the planet, and see what parks like Addo and Tembe are doing to preserve their future.

programme.title: Osprey: Sea Raptor
programme.desc: A veteran pair of osprey return home to a Connecticut saltmarsh. Over one summer they must battle their enemies, withstand the elements, and hunt hundreds and hundreds of fish, all to raise the next generation of sea raptors.

programme.title: After The Wildfires
programme.desc: Charting the long-term recovery of wildlife in the aftermath of Australia's catastrophic bushfires through stories of hope, human intervention and resilience, this film provides an urgent message to safeguard our environment before it is too late.

programme.title: Over Australia
programme.desc: From the vast, dry plains of the interior come some of Australia's most recognized imagery, such as the monolithic red rock of Uluru and the bounding red kangaroo. But how did the arid centre of the continent come to be?

programme.title: Over Australia
programme.desc: Created by titanic forces and spanning 3,700 km along the eastern edge of Australia, the Great Dividing Range separates two very different worlds. Aerial footage and intimate studies reveal how species survive and thrive in this mountain home.

programme.title: Wild Wild East
programme.desc: Brier Island is at the western point of the Bay of Fundy in Nova Scotia. And in the surrounding waters live an incredible number of humpback whales and dolphins. On still waters, Humpbacks smash their tails, flap their fins, and breach one en masse. It's an incredible sight. A pod of dolphins swims into the Bay of Fundy, feeding off herring. They're soon joined by an Orca that capitalizes on their feeding strategies.

programme.title: Animals At Play
programme.desc: Discover how species buddy up for group games with astonishing benefits. See how various animals, from young hyenas playing tug of war to mischievous monkeys getting rough and tumble, communicate the rules of their antics.

programme.title: Secret Life of the Wombat
programme.desc: In the cool highlands near Australia's Snowy Mountains is Wombat Wood. There, dotted amongst the trees and dense foliage, are over a hundred wombat burrows. But when some of the burrows are flooded, the wombats need to find safety.

programme.title: Secret Life of the Wombat
programme.desc: Wombats are solitary, slow-moving creatures, but breeding time brings out their energy, aggression and lots of play. Meet a southern hairy-nosed wombat named Birri, who's trying to find a mate, along with a female named Winnie and her joey, Fred.

programme.title: Great Blue Wild
programme.desc: Researcher Andrea Marshall believes Mozambique-based manta rays may be attending the sardine run on South Africa's Wild Coast. The question is: why? Follow researchers as they track the creatures to understand their unusual migrating patterns.

programme.title: Great Blue Wild
programme.desc: Mozambique's coastline is home to an array of marine life, but no species is safe from overfishing. Join the region's leading researchers on their journey to find and understand one of the ocean's most secretive creatures, before it's too late.

programme.title: Great Blue Wild
programme.desc: The coast of Mozambique is home to giants, like humpbacks and whale sharks, but the tiniest species play just as big of a role in the ecosystem. Meet the scientists who are working against the clock to protect coastal creatures big and small.

programme.title: Kingdom Of The Tide
programme.desc: Low tide exposes a band of shore called the intertidal zone. It's a place of stunning extremes, attacked by hurricane force waves and exposed to baking heat. Creatures here have evolved in countless bizarre ways. Scientists explore this alien realm.

programme.title: Alien Abyss
programme.desc: Get acquainted with an array of ocean oddballs and learn how billions of years' worth of changes, from ice ages to asteroid strikes, have shaped their looks and skills. Meet blind worms who fish, walking sharks, tree-climbing crabs, and much more.

programme.title: Alien Abyss
programme.desc: Feel the love in the strange-but-heartwarming partnerships between some of Earth's oddest creatures. Dive deep to see strange animals, from snapping shrimp to wolf eels, offer a hand to their fellow ocean-going weirdos to ensure mutual survival.

programme.title: Africa's Underwater Wonders
programme.desc: With its lush mangrove forests, vibrant coral gardens, and nutrient-dense waters, tiny Mafia Island off the coast of Tanzania is a rich feeding ground. Watch as the full moon brings a visit from a mysterious ocean giant, rising from the deep to feed.

programme.title: Africa's Underwater Wonders
programme.desc: Life is full of surprises in the freshwater expanse of Lake Malawi. Witness dazzling displays of evolution that unfold over remarkably short periods of time, and meet the magnificent, quirky, and unique creatures that have made the lake their home.

programme.title: Nature Scenes
programme.desc: One half hour of uninterrupted frog ponds. Get up close and personal with exoctic, colourful and poisonous frogs including the poison dart frog and green tree frog.

programme.title: Ol Pejeta Diaries
programme.desc: Watch as a 14-year-old blind black rhino becomes the new ambassador for the species at the reserve, and a fight between dominant males leads to the death of a wild black rhino.

programme.title: Ol Pejeta Diaries
programme.desc: Follow staff as they attempt the tricky task of relocating 2,000 endangered hartebeests. The goal: transfer the animals from a corner of the park to a new area so the land can be resettled by refugees.

programme.title: Tales From Zambia
programme.desc: Visit animals in three extraordinary habitats: a baby giraffe takes its first steps in the sweltering Luangwa Valley, two thousand baboons have found a paradise in a Kasanka forest, and a cheetah family prowls for meat on the desolate Liuwa Plain.

programme.title: Volcanic Odysseys
programme.desc: Tom explores how volcanoes have influenced Mexico's people and history. See how volcanic eruptions have destroyed ancient cultures-and how their unique landscapes have given rise to one of the world's most famous alcoholic beverages.

programme.title: Wildlife Icons
programme.desc: Cape Town, South Africa is home to twenty types of frogs, but many are threatened by urban development. Meet a variety of the region's species as we follow western leopard toads on their tenuous journey to breed in the city's shrinking wetlands.

programme.title: Great Blue Wild
programme.desc: The coast of Mozambique is home to giants, like humpbacks and whale sharks, but the tiniest species play just as big of a role in the ecosystem. Meet the scientists who are working against the clock to protect coastal creatures big and small.

programme.title: Into The Wild Colombia
programme.desc: Meet Blanco, a young capuchin, living in the rainforest. Blanco's home looks like paradise but he faces rival gangs and predators, including king vultures and jaguars, and must learn to find food. Can his family teach him before it's too late?

programme.title: Into The Wild Colombia
programme.desc: Emblamatic of Columbia's biodiversity, 150 species of hummingbirds can be found in its varied landscapes. Follow two mothers working to raise their young, a helmetcrest of the high altitude páramo, and an emerald hummingbird living in the rainforest.

programme.title: Guardians Of The Wild
programme.desc: Explore the largest, wildest protected area of Zambia, where a team of biologists and vets races against the oncoming rainy season to save and protect Africa's endangered top predators, including cheetahs, wild dogs, and lions.

programme.title: Wildest New Zealand
programme.desc: Spring on the east coast is a time of promise for two iconic island species: the New Zealand fur seal and the northern royal albatross. Both have returned to the land of their birth to breed.

programme.title: Wildest New Zealand
programme.desc: New Zealand's isolated islands form an unusual paradise, home to a variety of incredible wildlife. Flightless birds, ancient reptiles, and coastal mammals take centre stage, but a closer look reveals another world.

programme.title: America's Wild Border: Northern Exposure
programme.desc: Trail Atlantic puffins, Prairie rattlesnakes, Alaskan caribou, and other animals as they travel across the international boundary between the U.S. and Canada. See how they can move from safety to target by crossing a line they had no say in creating.

programme.title: Wild Pacific Rescue
programme.desc: Battle wind and waves to find a sea lion trapped in a plastic ring. Then visit the rescue centre, where over 80 orphan seals must be fed several times a day to prepare for release into the wild, and see an Amazonian duck get a miraculous operation.

programme.title: Wild Pacific Rescue
programme.desc: Follow the team in healing and releasing a grumpy sea turtle, and then meet a sea lion with an unusual injury that must be taken by crane to the rescue centre. Find out how the vet aids an aging fruit bat and a community rescues a one-eyed seal pup.

programme.title: Wildlife Icons
programme.desc: Cape Town, South Africa is home to twenty types of frogs, but many are threatened by urban development. Meet a variety of the region's species as we follow western leopard toads on their tenuous journey to breed in the city's shrinking wetlands.

programme.title: Great Blue Wild
programme.desc: The coast of Mozambique is home to giants, like humpbacks and whale sharks, but the tiniest species play just as big of a role in the ecosystem. Meet the scientists who are working against the clock to protect coastal creatures big and small.

programme.title: Animals Decoded
programme.desc: Could undiscovered animal languages save some of our most endangered species? From subtle scents to colours that are invisible to the human eye, uncover the hidden ways creatures communicate, which scientists are only starting to understand.

programme.title: Macro Worlds
programme.desc: Uncover the fascinating strategies insects use to survive through the coldest days of winter. In brilliant colour and slow motion, see ladybugs gather to stave off freezing and earwigs mercilessly defend their underground breeding chambers.

programme.title: Nature Scenes
programme.desc: Half an hour of uninterrupted views of giraffes and zebras as they eat and play.

programme.title: Ol Pejeta Diaries
programme.desc: Join the conservation team as they try to move two white rhinos into the reserve from the nearby Enasoit ranch. Poachers had been watching the animals, and the staff is determined to save this endangered pair.

programme.title: Ol Pejeta Diaries
programme.desc: With elephant numbers on the rise, so too are the conflicts. Watch the staff as they handle a gang of crop-raiding Pachyderms, remove a collar from a blind elephant, and receive the order to detusk three of the problem animals.

programme.title: Tales From Zambia
programme.desc: Tiny kingfishers, flocks of great white pelicans, endangered vultures, and countless other species of birds have all found a use for every inch of the Luangwa Valley. Watch these winged wonders search for food, shelter, and mates.

programme.title: The Explosion Show (S1)
programme.desc: Tory Belleci and Streetbike Tommy meet experts of the battlefield who recreate black powder blasts from the Civil War.

programme.title: How Do They Do It? (S6)
programme.desc: Dirt is used to put the stainless in stainless steel. Next, luxury limousines are lengthened to make the ultimate smooth ride, and koalas' favorite snack is turned into office stationary.

programme.desc: Blades are built tough enough for military helicopters. Then, futuristic subway systems are created using ghost trains, and bigger waves are produced for thrill-seeking surfers.

programme.desc: Learn how heated skate blades, gliders, hand bells, and fire hoses are made.
